creditline: The Clarence H. White Collection, assembled and organized by Professor Clarence H. White Jr., and given in memory of Lewis F. White, Dr. Maynard P. White Sr., and Clarence H. White Jr., the sons of Clarence H. White Sr. and Jane Felix White

makers.displaydate: 1871–1925; born West Carlisle, OH; died Mexico City, Mexico; active Ohio and New York
makers.displaymaker: print probably by Clarence H. White, 1871–1925; born West Carlisle, OH; died Mexico City, Mexico; active Ohio and New York

texts.textentryhtml:
Created by an unidentified photographer. Acquired by Clarence H. White Sr., between ca. 1890 and July 7, 1925; by descent to Clarence H. White Jr., on or after July 8, 1925 [1]; by descent to Clarence H. White Jr.’s widow, Ruth Royer White, 1978 [2]; bequest, to Princeton University Art Museum, 1983 [3].

Notes:

[1]. Possibly on the occasion of Clarence H. White Sr.’s death, as part of the Clarence H. White Collection.
[2]. On the occasion of Clarence H. White Jr.’s death.
[3]. Carried out by Ruth Royer White on behalf of Clarence H. White Jr.
texts.remarks: as per research by Grace Xiao & Cecilia Moore - Summer 2024

bibliography.boilertext: Anne McCauley, Clarence H. White and His World: The Art and Craft of Photography 1895–1925 (Yale University Press: New Haven and London, 2017)
bibliography.citation: Anne McCauley, Clarence H. White and His World: The Art and Craft of Photography 1895–1925 (Yale University Press: New Haven and London, 2017), p. 108

White (1871–1925; born West Carlisle, OH; died Mexico City, Mexico; active Ohio and New York), Untitled [Maude Adams in "Joan of Arc"], 1909. Platinum print. The Clarence H. White Sr. and Jane Felix White (x1983-1724)
